df-omnd
blocks.content: Define class of all right ordered monoids. An ordered monoid is a monoid with a total ordering compatible with its operation. It is possible to use this definition also for left ordered monoids, by applying it to ` ( oppG `` M ) ` . (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 13-Mar-2018.)

  -| diffss(s4, s5)

  -| diffss(s0, s4)

  -| diffss(s2, s4)

axiom df-omnd(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6) {
  ⊢ oMnd = { s0 ∈ Mnd |[(Base ` s0)/ s1][(+ ` s0)/ s2][(le ` s0)/ s3](s0 ∈ Toset ∧ ∀(s4 ∈ s1, ∀(s5 ∈ s1, ∀(s6 ∈ s1,(s4[s3]s5 →(s4[s2]s6)[s3](s5[s2]s6))))))}
  ⊣ d(s4, s5)
  ⊣ d(s4, s6)
  ⊣ d(s0, s4)
  ⊣ d(s3, s4)
  ⊣ d(s2, s4)
  ⊣ d(s1, s4)
  ⊣ d(s5, s6)
  ⊣ d(s0, s5)
  ⊣ d(s3, s5)
  ⊣ d(s2, s5)
  ⊣ d(s1, s5)
  ⊣ d(s0, s6)
  ⊣ d(s3, s6)
  ⊣ d(s2, s6)
  ⊣ d(s1, s6)
  ⊣ d(s0, s3)

  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s2, s3)
  ⊣ d(s1, s3)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
}

blocks.name: df-ogrp
blocks.content: Define class of all ordered groups. An ordered group is a group with a total ordering compatible with its operation. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 13-Mar-2018.)
